description:
We are Relativity. A market-leading, global tech company that equips legal and compliance professionals with a powerful platform to organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. The US Department of Justice, 199 of the Am Law 200, and more than 329,000 enabled users trust Relativity during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.

Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.

We believe that great talent is not bound by geography and that what you do matters more than where you do it. Relativity has assumed a hybrid work strategy, allowing choice and flexibility for employees to work either from home, a physical Relativity office location (once safe to do so), or a combination of the two, within certain logistical boundaries. Submit your application to learn more from our recruiters or contact us for more details.

  • Below are the teams within the Processing and Imaging & Productions product domain that are hiring interns:
Processing
Relativity's document "Processing" product is the fastest way to feed terabytes of complex data into Relativity's Review platform. As part of the Processing team, you will help build and enhance our cloud native and scalable engine that handles millions of files spanning hundreds of file types at market leading speeds. If an opportunity to tackle big-data scalability challenges while working with cloud technologies (Kubernetes, Kafka) and languages (Scala) excites you, then this is the right team for you. We are looking to add new members to our teams who share our passion for leveraging the latest technology to solve complex problems and build world class software.

Imaging & Productions
Relativity Productions is a suite of tools that help our customers efficiently Act on the truth they have discovered.

Our suite of tools enables our users to convert native documents to images so they can be redacted, OCR redacted documents to ensure that just the appropriate information is disseminated, stamp documents with metadata so they can be tracked, and bundle it all up in PDFs for easy distribution. So, whether it’s preparing a set of evidence for trial or responding to a FOIA request, our software helps users get the information ready to be delivered quickly and confidently.

Join our team as we work to add new capabilities and utilize cloud native technologies to support processing millions of documents daily in our SaaS product. To achieve this, you will build software using a diverse set of technologies including C#/.NET, JavaScript, C++, Azure, SQL, and Docker/Kubernetes.

Collections
Relativity Collect is a cloud native application to obtain electronically stored information from multitude of data sources. This is the first step in the e-discovery process.

Our data collectors are developed and executed on a state-of-the-art job framework called C4, which are an extension to Kubernetes technology. Our goal is to build highly scalable and performant data collectors from variety of cloud data sources while keeping the information defensible. Come join our team as we expand our footprint to collect information from O365, GSuites, Slack, Box to name a few.

Legal Hold
Our team owns the Legal Hold product, and they own and operate the Relativity OneLegal Hold SaaS instance, hosted in Azure.

A legal hold is a process that an organization uses to preserve all forms of relevant information when litigation is reasonably anticipated. Custodians subject to a litigation hold must preserve all electronically stored data (ESI) that they have access to. This requires no deletion or editing of files, documents, or any other ESI that is potentially relevant to a litigation.

Relativity Legal Hold is an application that attorneys, paralegals, and corporations use to manage legal hold workflows, communications, acknowledgements, reminders, and the custodian portal within their organization. Providing a sophisticated integration that includes active monitoring of Microsoft Office 365, Relativity Legal Hold also provides "Preservation in Place" holds ensuring that relevant ESI is preserved in its original state, even if a custodian disobeys a litigation hold notice and attempts to delete or edit relevant ESI. The product is executing Relativity's strategy to increase our footprint into corporations

Data Grid
Join our Data Grid Engineering group where we specialize in Organizing Data and Discovering the Truth faster and more efficiently. Our team is responsible storing, retrieving, and searching vast amounts of data efficiently by leveraging the latest technologies.

As part of the Data Grid team, you will be dealing with these unique challenges of storing, retrieving and indexing tremendous amount of data at blazing speeds.

You will be working with diverse set of technologies such as .NET, Azure, Elasticsearch, Docker, Kubernetes, and SQL. If an opportunity to deal with big-data, solve complex scalability, and performance challenges, and to learn an exciting set of technologies on a secure SaaS platform excites you, then this is the right team for you.

Responsibilities:
Learn and use new technologies and popular programming languages to design, build, and test our platform, Relativity
Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
Learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers.
Actively participate in the SCRUM process
Troubleshoot issues
Qualficiations
Current student, pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math or related area of study
Experience with and a passion for web development
Desire to work the Agile development methodology
Effective communicator
Team player
At Relativity, we live our core values and we thrive on solving complex problems. We’re dedicated to continually improving our product and providing relentless customer service, and we’re always looking for people to join us on the journey.

Relativity is a team of smart, passionate people always looking to grow, contribute, and make our product and customer service the best it can be. Our team members come from diverse backgrounds with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

description:
Summer 2021 internship applications are open September 2020. Samsung Semiconductor summer internships start in May/June 2021.

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll work with the teams that create new computing system architectures needed to support emerging machine learning applications, internet of things (IoT) and edge computing that benefit millions of users. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.

OVERVIEW

Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.

Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. is a world leader in Memory and Storage technologies. We are currently looking for Data Analytics Engineer (Intern) to join our team in San Jose, CA. The Data Engineer Intern will contribute to memory and storage system research in the Memory Solutions Lab. He or she will join a team of experts in researching and developing innovative memory and storage system solutions that utilize existing and emerging technologies to add substantial value to storage systems. The ideal candidate must have a strong understanding of storage technologies including file systems, Linux I/O Stack, Linux performance profiling and computer architecture.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Implement software and design machine learning or deep learning models using existing big data/AI frameworks to analyze collected server telemetry data for various predictions and insights
Propose possible approaches and methods to solve complex analytics problems related to storage workloads and management
Analyze large sets of collected server telemetry data, create machine learning models and generate verifiable results
Work with team members to contribute towards prototyping efforts.
Create new and useful IP, publish at conferences, and generate whitepapers.

REQUIRED SKILLS

Pursuing an MS or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field, with focus on data modeling and data science.
Good knowledge of popular Big Data frameworks
Research and development experience with Spark, Presto, Hive, Hadoop, and NoSQL Databases
Experience with deploying and debugging applications across server clusters
Prior experience with storage performance analysis and optimization will be a big plus.
Track record of innovation and creativity in problem solving.
Must be highly motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong background in C/C++/Python/Java/Scala.
Comfortable working in a multinational environment and understands how to leverage cultural diversity.
Inherent technical curiosity

*************************************************************************************

Samsung Semiconductor Inc (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

description:
The Bear Institute for Health Innovation is a first-of-its kind pediatric health information technology (IT) institute with a vision for a future where children grow to their highest level of health and potential. Formed in September 2013, the Bear Institute is a strategic partnership between Children’s National Hospital and Cerner Corporation. The organization assumes all operational and administrative responsibilities for Children’s IT services, including implementations, system management, and clinical adoption. The Bear Institute also provides innovative technologies that contribute to improved outcomes for pediatric patients, developed by our Bear Innovations Team. This innovative partnership has resulted in a number of achievements and awards, including a District of Columbia Hospital Association (DCHA) Patient Safety Award, a PNC Charitable Trust grant, guest speaking at HIMSS & ACHE on Innovation and Quality Improvements, and a Davies Award.

As a software engineering intern with the Bear Innovations Team, you will work closely with other software engineers to develop minimally viable prototypes using AGILE methodology. Various programming languages, UI software, visualization tools, and platforms will be used. This requires the ability to learn independently and apply new skills quickly. You will gain experience in rapidly prototyping, measuring, and iterating. This will be in collaboration with nationally recognized clinical leaders and world renowned researchers at Children’s National Hospital. If you want to develop you skills working on challenging digital health technology innovation focused on improving health care for future generations, come join Bear Innovations!

From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than 25,000 facilities in over 35 countries.

  • Below are the teams within Cloud Engineering that are hiring interns:
Cloud Engineering – Kubernetes Infrastructure Services
If you are interested in pushing a major architectural change through an enterprise-level engineering organization, the Infrastructure Services team is the right place for you. This team is focused on creating immutable infrastructure to host multiple shared services in the Azure cloud. Currently focused on Kubernetes and Jenkins as a Service, our team will continue to leverage cutting edge technologies such as Docker, Prometheus, Istio, and more. Our efforts will help Relativity Engineering teams completely transform our architecture to be more cloud native, while taking advantage of everything a distributed microservice architecture has to offer. Actual experience using these technologies is not a requirement, but we do seek candidates with strong engineering fundamentals, self-motivation, and an interest in DevOps principles (ownership from coding to Production support).

Potential Intern Projects/Work:
  • Development of Kubernetes operator applications
  • Redundancy and high availability functionality of Kubernetes cluster infrastructure
  • Testing automation System and dependency verifications
Cloud Engineering – RelativityOne File PaaS
Come join the FilePaaS team, which owns all unstructured data storage needs for the Relativity application. The FilePaaS team manages the internal storage servers upon which all of Relativity relies. We develop and maintain the infrastructure and the control plane that facilitates the provisioning and consumption of file storage space. We develop storage-layer abstractions to increase our platform's data management capabilities, reduce costs, and increase business agility. Our key challenge: how do we simplify and optimize the management of petabyte-scale cloud storage to the delight of our customers and developers?

Our team is looking to build out the next generation of infrastructure. Join us as we work to leverage cloud-native technologies to respond to the scale of Relativity’s increasing growth as well as to idiosyncratic nature of massive-scale storage. To achieve this, our team is using a diverse set of technologies, including Linux, Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, Powershell, C#/.NET, and SQL. As a member of this team, you will contribute to optimizing and refining the existing service, maintaining its operational state, adopting design and development best practices, and working with senior engineers to implement new features. You may work on our storage abstraction layer, data plane, as well as the control plane that manages these in order to deliver petabyte-scale, cloud-native storage solutions for Relativity.

Cloud Engineering - RelativityOne SQL PaaS
Our SQL PaaS team is building a SQL Platform as a Service (PaaS) unique to Relativity based on SQL Server and Azure cloud technologies. We are building a proprietary high-availability replication and database movement technology. The SQL PaaS is responsible for orchestration, provisioning, scale, configuration, and monitoring of data hosted in the platform. The technology is deployed globally in multiple Azure regions and hosts hundreds of terabytes of data and hundreds of thousands of SQL Databases.

Here you will have the opportunity to solve significant complex scalability, availability and performance challenges while learning new cloud development best practices using technologies like Azure, .NET core, Serverless Compute, Chef, PowerShell, and Jenkins. If being part of a team building out a PaaS sounds interesting to you, we would love to hear from you!

Cloud Engineering – R1 Monitoring & Site Reliability
The RelativityOne Monitoring and Site Reliability teams build systems to detect infrastructure and application level events before they impact customers. We funnel that data to RelativityOne Operations, Business Analysis, and Engineering teams for in-depth analysis on performance, utilization, and availability.

Join our team as we implement end to end observability with cutting edge technologies such as OpenTelemetry, powerful timeseries databases such as Splunk, and machine learning and analytics to monitor a SaaS application. The technical environment includes Kubernetes, OpenTelemetry, Azure functions, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Event Hub (Kafka), and Kubernetes; we code in C#.NET, Go and Powershell.

Responsibilities:
Learn and use new technologies and popular programming languages to design, build, and test our platform, Relativity
Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
Learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers.
Actively participate in the SCRUM process
Troubleshoot issues

Current student, pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math or related area of study
Experience with and a passion for web development
Desire to work the Agile development methodology

description:
Let’s face it. Technology is moving way too fast for commercial security solutions to keep up. Even choosing best of breed solutions means you have to integrate tools not built to work together out-of-the-box. At some point you have to build some custom tooling to get to the next level.

That’s where the Cvent Security Engineering team comes in. We are maturing our security capabilities through a combination of commercial solutions, open source solutions, and custom developed solutions. As Cvent develops solutions at the leading edge of technology, we are racing along with them to develop solutions to secure them.

What You Will Be Doing

This position is a technical, hands-on role that involves small scale software development support work as well configuration and customization of security tools, in order to facilitate analysis of network and web threats, security architectures, new technology designs, and other areas. Custom development of solutions in AWS Cloud will be at the forefront of the work using native AWS solutions like Lambda, Config, EC2, ECS, SecurityHub, GuardDuty, and more. You should also be able to adapt quickly and willing to learn new ways to implement scripting in a fast-paced and high-profile technology landscape. You will work with the latest and best of breed security tools, systems, and network technologies. A thirst for knowledge, a curious mind, and the desire to continuously stay abreast of new developments in the dynamic security space is a must.

You will work with and mentor under a team of security engineers with decades of combined experience. As our past learning programs and internships have demonstrated, you will get valuable knowledge and experience at an accelerated rate beyond what a traditional education can offer.

Position Duties:
  • Work with a team to help develop solutions to drive automation for the Security Engineering and Operations teams across our external products and enterprise
  • Support creation of solutions to leverage and improve upon AWS native tools in order to facilitate protection and detection capabilities
  • Script solutions to access and unify data from different security telemetry with data normalization and ETL
  • Develop integrations between automation platforms, cybersecurity tools, and other information systems
  • Collaborate and communicate effectively with the Security Team
  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies related to security and security automation
What You Need for this Position:
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related degree
  • Comfortable with Python or Java
  • Familiarity with Web Services Development and API Experience
  • Passion and aptitude for learning other languages as necessary
  • Familiarity with the AWS platform and services such as Config, Lambda, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, S3, WAF, GuardDuty, Shield
  • Ability to adapt to a hyper-growth pace and changing priorities
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills; outstanding oral and written communication skills
  • Some knowledge of information security principles, networks, operating systems
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Familiarity with one or more security tools: Splunk, DLP, WAF, Carbon Black, or Nessus
  • Knowledge of high traffic and other cloud-based infrastructures and how they affect security needs (i.e. cloud infrastructure, AWS, VMWare, SOA architectures) would be a plus
  • Familiarity with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) platforms like Demisto

The Big Data team is a central player in the Poshmark organization. Our mission is to build a world-class big data platform to bring value out of data for us and for our customers. description:
We are Relativity. A market-leading, global tech company that equips legal and compliance professionals with a powerful platform to organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. The US Department of Justice, 199 of the Am Law 200, and more than 329,000 enabled users trust Relativity during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.

Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.

We believe that great talent is not bound by geography and that what you do matters more than where you do it. Relativity has assumed a hybrid work strategy, allowing choice and flexibility for employees to work either from home, a physical Relativity office location (once safe to do so), or a combination of the two, within certain logistical boundaries. Submit your application to learn more from our recruiters or contact us for more details.

  • Below are the teams within Review/Core that are hiring interns:
Core
We are modernizing our front-end architecture, and we're looking to grow teams of engineers who are passionate about user experience, automation and performance.

You will be developing brand new features to make clients’ lives easier, and the user interface more intuitive, accessible, and performant. You will be working with JavaScript and frameworks like Aurelia and AngularJS. You will also be writing and maintaining API endpoints utilizing .NET, and connecting with cloud-based services such as Azure Logic Apps or Event Grid. You will be working in a blended build environment of both Node.js and MSBuild.You will be writing unit tests using Jasmine/Karma and NUnit.

If you love solving problems, building great products, working among strong teams, and want to make a visible impact, this role is for you.

Case Strategy
Case Strategy is a suite of applications which empowers case teams to construct winning cases by quickly and easily defining, validating and presenting their case strategy, while benefitting from a seamless integration into Relativity and all its features. Case Strategy consists of Case Dynamics, which assists users in collecting, organizing and analyzing facts, issues, organizations, people, interview questions and documents, while also seamlessly integrating into the Document Viewer and Transcript Viewer, which gives users the ability to upload, review, code, and annotate Transcript files in Relativity.

Case Strategy is a newly formed team and is full of energy. If you love solving complex problems and are thirsty for daily challenges, then come and join us, you will not be disappointed. You will mainly be working in JavaScript, Angular, and C#, but will also dabble in Aurelia and Relativity’s internal web components throughout 2020, as we are going to rewrite most of our front-end and make it adherent to the new look and feel of Relativity.

Review
The Review groups work on the Review Interface (RI), the part of Relativity where users spend 85% of their time. The RI is used to look at various documents, mark whether they’re relevant to the case, and optionally to apply redactions to hide sensitive information. We have just released a total rewrite of the RI. We continue to innovate on top of the new RI.
As part of our team, you will be using technologies such as Type Script, a superset of Java Script, Aurelia framework, and Azure. Projects might include optimizing new components or starting work on advanced features, such as an investigative UI, that will be delivered after the rewrite is done.

Potential projects include front end work to implement a new feature, back end Kepler work to support the front end, or build related projects. Past examples include adding a new search term in the front end, an Aurelia message to measure sign of life, or moving our build system to a new internal framework called Trident. We try to have all our projects make it into our shipping product instead of having them be “make work” projects.

Responsibilities:
Learn and use new technologies and popular programming languages to design, build, and test our platform, Relativity
Work on scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering, technologies, and client component interaction through web services
Learn how to build highly distributable systems composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers.
Actively participate in the SCRUM process
Troubleshoot issues

Qualifications:
Current student, pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math or related area of study
Experience with and a passion for web development
Desire to work the Agile development methodology
Effective communicator
Team player
At Relativity, we live our core values and we thrive on solving complex problems. We’re dedicated to continually improving our product and providing relentless customer service, and we’re always looking for people to join us on the journey.

Relativity is a team of smart, passionate people always looking to grow, contribute, and make our product and customer service the best it can be. Our team members come from diverse backgrounds with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll have the opportunity to work on different business initiatives while building in-depth technical knowledge and business acumen. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.

OVERVIEW

Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.

We are currently looking for exceptional software talent to join our team in San Jose, CA for the summer of 2021. We are currently looking for firmware/software engineers to join our rapidly growing effort to develop the next generation of enterprise solid-state flash technologies. Our core development focus is the host interface firmware layer that sits at the intersection of system software and flash management firmware. This key host interface firmware technology drives Samsung’s breakthrough V-NAND technology and enables our customer to power performance-oriented, demanding enterprise-class applications including Hyperscale data centers, big data processing and software-defined virtualized storage arrays and infrastructures.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Triage and root cause system, driver and device interoperability issues
Development and Debugging of firmware and software for cutting-edge enterprise SSD products
Debug, optimize & validate/test SSD firmware on embedded multi-core architectures
Support customer qualification of SSD products on OEM Storage Racks and Servers.
Learn operations of cutting-edge SSD, system-level operation and test tool suites
Write debug software; work with real-time systems and hardware debugging
Analyze NVMe or SAS protocol & debug utilities; write API for interpretation of data
Develop test cases for actual product development
Research and document main issues and feature gaps by testing existing products and system configurations
Gain expertise with SSD test automation environment
Work with technical lead to present reports to group detailing project work

Pursuing a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or software-focused Electrical Engineering
Knowledge of storage systems and familiarity with flash devices
Comfortable in lab environment & interacting with teams; good communication skills
Knowledge of revision control tools and processes, including Subversion, Bazaar, or Git and knowledge of C/C++ development for embedded systems, including storage devices and other embedded platforms is desirable.
Knowledge or Experience with one or more of the following storage related technologies: NAND Flash/FTL, Fiber Channel, NVM Express (NVMe), SAS, SATA, SCSI, SSD, PCI Express (PCIe), eMMC or UFS is desirable
Knowledge or Experience with ARM or equivalent embedded multi-core microprocessor architectures & experience with JTAG/ICE debuggers & protocol analyzers is desirable
Scripting experience in one of Python/Perl/JavaScript is desirable
Familiarity and experience with modern agile software development methodologies and practices is desirable.

description:
You are someone who loves creating mobile applications that have a simple user interface and solid code while leading a team. If you have a passion for developing new user experiences, solving difficult problems and creating delightful solutions, this is a perfect job for you! As an intern, you have the unique opportunity to play a critical part in defining and building the perfect experience for millions, developing scalable, well-designed software that enhances people's lives globally. Join our world-class team and help build the future of Poshmark.

What You'll Do:
Over 10 weeks the intern can expect to become deeply involved in learning the tech stack, implement new technologies, standards and best practices that may run in production. We're nothing without our amazing team of leaders, innovators and dreamers; the people who put all the pieces together to deliver an unparalleled social shopping experience to the millions of people we connect each day.

Architect and maintain our set of native mobile applications.
Partner closely with our design and product team to architect a gorgeous application flow.
Influence different aspect of the development process like API creation, design, and product.
Envision new products and features that are inspired, considered, and magical

Experience relevant to Poshmark:
Pursuing a CS degree (or related field)
Knowledge of at least one of the language Java or Kotlin
A curious nature with a desire to tackle and solve complex problems
Non-academic coding experience (i.e. hack-a-thons, code challenges, personal projects, GitHub, Open Source, volunteer coding experience, conference participation, Grace Hopper, etc.)

Things that catch our eye:
Experience with development in a high traffic, highly scaled environment is a plus
Experience in any of the following highly desirable - NodeJs, Vue.Js, React, Angular, Ruby, Rails, jQuery, Mongodb
Developed and Android app

Why Poshmark?

Poshmark is a leading social commerce platform for the next generation of retailers and shoppers. Through technology, our mission is to build the world's most connected shopping experience, while empowering people to build thriving retail businesses. Since launching in 2011, Poshmark has become a vibrant social shopping community with five million Seller Stylists helping 40 million users discover items they love from over 75 million listings. The company is backed by the world's leading investment firms including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit www.poshmark.com, or find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and YouTube.

About us

At Poshmark, we're constantly challenging the status quo and are looking for innovative and passionate people to help shape the future of Poshmark. We're disrupting the industry by combining social connections with e-commerce through data-driven solutions and the latest technology to optimize our platform. We're nothing without our amazing team who deliver an unparalleled social shopping experience to the millions of people we connect each day.

We built Poshmark around four core values: 1) focus on people to create empowered communities that drive success; 2) together we grow to support each other to strive for our dreams; 3) lead with love to foster genuine connections built upon a foundation of respect; and 4) embrace your weirdness to accept and empower one another on their own unique journey. We're invested in our team and community, working together to build an entirely new way to shop. That way, when we win, we all win together. Come help us build the most connected shopping experience ever.

Here's what we'll set you up with:
A team that is invested in your career growth and training
Competitive pay, based on experience
Work alongside world-class talent
Personal style encouraged (or not, whatever you're in to)

Poshmark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

position: WEST - San Jose - Risk Consulting Intern - Summer 2021
qualifications:

description:
What to expect

At EY Consulting, we are building a better working world by transforming businesses through the power of people, technology and innovation. Our clients are at the heart of what we do. We’re focused on solving the key issues of our client buyers, building deeper relationships and making a greater impact with long-term value.

We focus on a variety of industries including but not limited to:

Advanced Manufacturing & Mobility, Power & Utilities, Health Sciences & Wellness, Consumer, and Technology, Media & Entertainment, Telecommunications.
Candidates can elect to join the Government & Public Sector (GPS) practice and will work exclusively with federal clients, as well as state and local agencies and higher education institutions.
Candidates can elect to join the Financial Services Organization (FSO) and will focus exclusively in financial services; they will have opportunities to serve leading investment banks, retail and commercial banks, insurers and investment managers.

Whether you choose to join GPS, FSO, or pursue a broader industry focus, you will gain foundational skills for a long career.

When you join our Consulting practice as a staff, you're a part of our Consultant Development Program. You'll be provided learning opportunities, technical competency training, and coaching to develop core consulting skills. As a part of the Enterprise Risk and Technology Risk team, you will work hand-in-hand with senior team members to help clients improve their business performance through establishing and maintaining an effective risk and control environment. This involves assessing risks in either an advisory or audit context – both of which enable you to develop an in-depth understanding of a company’s business and IT processes, risks and controls.

Your key responsibilities may include:
Growing lasting relationships with our clients and understanding their unique ambitions and needs to deliver reliable, tailored advice
Understanding and documenting clients’ business and IT processes, risks, and controls
Performing control documentation and testing through review of client evidence and interviews
Using knowledge of the current IT environment to identify the engagement and client service issues, perform root cause analysis, and communicate this information to the engagement team through written correspondence and verbal presentations
Collaborating with members of the engagement team to plan the engagement and develop work program timelines, assign responsibilities for key tasks and prepare other planning documents
Taking full responsibility for tasks including consistent self-review of work to identify and improve an approach for producing high quality deliverables, while working under supervision

To qualify for the role you must have:
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Accounting, Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance or Management or a related discipline
Desire to work in consulting and IT audit as demonstrated by relevant course work, interest or internship experience
The flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary
The understanding that travel is an essential function of the job, may vary by location and can range between 60-80%
Proficiency with MS Office, including MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
Willingness and ability to learn and work independently with minimal supervision
Demonstrated project management, teaming, organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to project deadlines
Integrity within a professional environment
A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
Candidates interested in the Government & Public Sector focus must have sole U.S. citizenship and be able to obtain and maintain a secret clearance or higher, within the designated time frame, which will be determined by the engagement requirements for a security clearance.

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.

Plus, we offer:
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams
About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply today

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Why Poshmark?

Poshmark is a leading social commerce platform for the next generation of retailers and shoppers. Through technology, our mission is to build the world's most connected shopping experience, while empowering people to build thriving retail businesses. Since launching in 2011, Poshmark has become a vibrant social shopping community with five million Seller Stylists helping 40 million users discover items they love from over 75 million listings. The company is backed by the world's leading investment firms including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit www.poshmark.com, or find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and YouTube.

About us

At Poshmark, we're constantly challenging the status quo and are looking for innovative and passionate people to help shape the future of Poshmark. We're disrupting the industry by combining social connections with e-commerce through data-driven solutions and the latest technology to optimize our platform. We're nothing without our amazing team who deliver an unparalleled social shopping experience to the millions of people we connect each day.

We built Poshmark around four core values: 1) focus on people to create empowered communities that drive success; 2) together we grow to support each other to strive for our dreams; 3) lead with love to foster genuine connections built upon a foundation of respect; and 4) embrace your weirdness to accept and empower one another on their own unique journey. We're invested in our team and community, working together to build an entirely new way to shop. That way, when we win, we all win together. Come help us build the most connected shopping experience ever.

Here's what we'll set you up with:
A team that is invested in your career growth and training
Competitive pay, based on experience
Work alongside world-class talent
Personal style encouraged (or not, whatever you're in to)

Poshmark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description:
Summer 2021 internship applications are open September 2020. Samsung Semiconductor summer internships start in May/June 2021.

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll work with the teams that create new computing system architectures needed to support emerging machine learning applications, internet of things (IoT) and edge computing that benefit millions of users. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.

OVERVIEW

Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.

The Image Sensor Lab (ISL) at Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. focuses on the research and development of innovative image sensors and optical devices including low-power high-resolution depth and LiDAR sensors, ultra-compact spectroscopic elements, and advanced bio-inspired sensors and systems with cutting-edge features, high efficiency, and wide viewing-angle. The team aims at representing Samsung's leadership in advanced sensor and imaging products. This is an exciting and unique opportunity for a talented and hard-working PhD student to get involved in envisioning, prototyping and implementing cutting-edge products with a growing team. Interns are expected to implement and research production-level imaging solutions in both hardware and software domain and writing patents.

Come join Samsung ISL and enjoy building state-of-the-art imaging solutions!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Explore cutting-edge technologies for our products, responsibilities may include but not limited to:
Data acquisition and processing from prototype cameras
Evaluation and characterization of camera and sensor performance
Development, implementation, debug, evaluation of algorithms for real-time 2D/3D image processing and object recognition
Development, implementation of algorithms for 3D point cloud generation, image processing, noise reduction
Development, implementation of algorithms for 2D/3D image fusion

REQUIRED SKILLS

Solid theoretical background in image processing, computer vision and machine learning
Excellent programming skills in C++, matlab etc.
Strong analytical skills
Excellent problem solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
PhD students in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or relevant fields

PREFERED SKILLS

Understand hardware design concepts and camera architecture
Ability to debug both software and hardware

***********************************************************************************************************************

Samsung Semiconductor Inc (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

description:
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

The Primary Role of this position is:
Working with a mentor, develop test programs for debugging, characterizing and production testing next-generation AMD processors. Work on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) platforms and System Level Test (SLT) platforms. Debug test infrastructure issues including test hardware, test software, and product-specific IP. Develop software tools and scripts that support Test process.

Support overall compatibility, compliance, and test coverage of processors from product definition through product qualification and into high volume production by developing product specific test hardware, software and diagnostics. The test platforms and test infrastructure use various coding and scripting languages like Java, C++, C, Python, PERL, and Ruby to manipulate the device under test to ensure proper device functionality.

Potential roles of a Product Development Co-op include:
Develops and implements test programs/software to test and analyze AMD products.
Develops test requirements and specifications.
Develops software tools and scripts that support test process, program debug/audit, test time analysis etc.
Performs logic and circuit design verification via software and hardware.
Works with product engineering, characterization and platform debug teams to define and debug existing and new products.
Debugs test infrastructure issues in hardware, software, device, or manufacturing flow domains.
Support product improvement activities including driving cost reduction and yield improvement initiatives and resolving quality issues.
Works on related projects and/or assignments as needed.

Qualifications:
Years of experience and education: Candidates will be enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering.

Required Skills:
Experience with C++ or other high level software programming languages (Java, C, C#)
Courses in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Digital Logic, Circuit Theory
Familiar with Linux or Unix Operating Systems
Familiar with Microsoft standard apps (i.e. Office), Microsoft Windows Operating Systems

Preferred Skills:
Scripting language experience with Perl, Ruby, shell script, or similar
Experience in the XP, AGILE, Scrum, and/or Kanban programming paradigms.

Experience with revision control (SVN,CVS,RCS or similar) on a large software project

Country: United States State: Texas City: Austin
Job Function: Student/ Intern/ Temp

description:
When you join our Technology Consulting practice as an intern, you're a part of our Consultant Development Program (CDP). Each individual experience will vary but through this program you'll be provided learning opportunities, technical competency training, and coaching to develop core consulting skills.

What to expect

At EY Consulting, we are building a better working world by transforming businesses through the power of people, technology and innovation. The advent of emerging tech is recasting all industries and requires our clients to embrace turning new technology capabilities into new competitive advantages. As a Technology Consultant you will help our clients actualize the potential of technology to improve processes and drive innovation through Cybersecurity, Digital and Emerging Technologies, Data & Analytics, Technology Solutions Delivery, and Technology Transformation.

Within Technology Consulting there are several opportunities within industry sectors; you can select your preference in our collect form, linked above.

Financial Services Organization (FSO):
As a Financial Services Technology Consulting intern, you will focus exclusively in financial services and will have the opportunity to serve leading investment banks, retail and commercial banks, insurers and investment managers.

Technology Consulting interns within FSO will have diversified experiences across clients and technology competencies. Once you have developed a strong foundation, we will work with you to determine a more specific area of concentration for the next phase of your career journey.

For those looking to have a specific area of concentration from the outset there is the opportunity to align to a Data & Analytics or Platform Implementation track.

National Consulting:
The National Consulting practice serves clients across a variety of industries including, but not limited to: Advanced Manufacturing & Mobility, Power & Utilities, Health Sciences & Wellness, Consumer, and Technology, Media & Entertainment, Telecommunications.

Technology Consulting interns within National Consulting will be aligned to one of the following tracks: Platforms, Data & Analytics, and Engineering.

Government & Public Sector (GPS):
As an intern with the Government & Public Sector practice, you’ll have the opportunity to work with federal clients, as well as state and local agencies and higher education institutions.

Technology consulting interns within GPS will be aligned to one of the following tracks: Technology Consulting or Data & Analytics.

Your key responsibilities may include:
Helping clients drive business-led and technology-enabled transformation across a broad range of business issues

Understanding and documenting clients’ business processes and requirements, performing root cause analyses, developing business cases, and gathering information

Taking full responsibility for tasks including consistent self-review of work to identify and improve an approach for producing high quality work products, while working under supervision

Growing lasting relationships with our clients, understanding their needs, and consistently delivering quality client services

Monitoring progress, managing risks and ensuring key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes

Developing specific technology skills relevant to engagement and project work

Continuously updating your understanding of current business and industry trends

To qualify for the role you must have:
Obtained or progress toward a bachelor’s degree in a relevant technology discipline, i.e. Computer Science, Computer or other technology-related Engineering, Information Systems, Information Technology, Statistics, Math, MIS

Desire to work in consulting demonstrated by relevant course work, interest or internship experience

Willingness and ability to learn and work independently with minimal supervision

Demonstrated project management, teaming, organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills

Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills

Effective organization and time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and adhere to project deadlines

Integrity within a professional environment

The flexibility and willingness to travel as well as work in excess of standard hours when necessary

The understanding that when it is safe to do so, travel is an essential function of the job, may vary by location and can be up to 80%

Proficiency with MS Office, including MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint

A driver’s license valid in the U.S.

Candidates interested in the Government & Public Sector industry focus must have sole U.S. citizenship and be able to obtain and maintain a secret clearance or higher, within the designated timeframe, which will be determined by the engagement requirements for a security clearance

In addition to the above qualifications we are seeking candidates with an aptitude, interest, and/or experience in any of the following:

Development skills such as Java, Javascript, .Net, Python, C, C++, PHP, IoT development, or web development

Analytics focused tools and platforms including, but not limited to, SQL, R, Tableau, Power BI, and Spotfire

Business process design, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software, such as SAP or Oracle, or integration tools

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.

Plus, we offer:
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession

Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career

Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply today

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

description:
Sea Machines is a fast-growing startup specializing in autonomous technology for marine vessels. We’re passionate about applying practical A.I. to the massive global ocean transportation market. Our products provide ships and workboats the intelligence to work remotely and give maritime operators the tools to effectively communicate with them. Based in Boston and operating globally, the company is crewed by an experienced team of mariners, engineers, coders, and autonomy scientists. Our culture is dynamic, collaborative and biased towards execution.

Sea Machines is venture-funded, and we’ve introduced our first product, the Sea Machines 300. We’re located on the East Boston waterfront in historic Jeffries Point, with quick access to the T and water taxis.

We are seeking a Perception Interns and Co-ops with deep learning and computer vision experience to actively push the next stage of perception R&D at Sea Machines which tackles the exciting challenges of moving the world’s fleets to the era of autonomous operations. This role will focus on developing state-of-arts algorithms on marine vessels to perform real time performance in conjunction with the existing R&D perception team. A focus will be on object detection, object tracking, semantic segmentation, and related data collection, organization and analysis.

Responsibilities

  • Design, development and integration of high-quality perception technology including objects detection, object tracking and semantic segmentation on SMR vessels
  • Analyze real world data and perform performance evaluation of delivered technology
  • Develop state of art prototype and implement high quality C++/python applications into the existing Sea Machines autonomy system.
  • Maintain software documentation and assist in the development of user documentation
  • Participate in field testing & trials, document and communicate bugs and issues encountered during testing & trials
  • Participate as a multi-disciplinary engineering team member including team meetings, stand-ups & quality reviews
  • Work cross-functionally with technical teams developing perception algorithm and system interfaces to execute functional testing, system integration verification and performance validation

Basic Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or received a Bachelor's or Master's or PhD's Degree in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or other equivalent related fields
  • Completed courses or certificates in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, or Computer Vision
  • Familiar with Python, Tensorflow, Keras, Ubuntu, OpenCV

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with deep learning based object detection, tracking or semantic segmentation
  • Experience with machine learning and image processing based image classification and segmentation
  • Experience with large scale data collection, organization, analysis and regression tools
  • Understanding and appreciation of hardened industrial systems
  • Excellent analytical and program solving skills, excellent written and oral communication, self-starter and highly motivated

Job Type: Internship

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Work authorization:

  • United States (Required)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Are you looking for a meaningful internship that will give you hands-on experience with a company that puts its employees first? Look no further than Hyland! We value our customers and employees alike and will help you reach your full potential no matter where you are in the world. An internship at Hyland is the start on your path to future success. Check us out!

This is a Professional Services & Consulting Internship for the Healthcare Admin Services I team. The position requires some technical aptitude, database knowledge, and an interest in business or processes.

Position to start summer 2021

What you will be doing

Participate in team meetings
Liaise with other areas to resolve information or project requests by department staff
Compile and analyze information and develop reports, proposals, or documents
Maintain accurate documentation and records on all projects assigned

Or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the principal duties of the position.

What you can expect next

Hyland Recruiters thoroughly review every application and will contact you within 1 to 2 weeks regarding next steps. Be sure to add Hyland to your contacts list and check your spam folder so you never miss a message from us!
Any follow up questions? Email your Recruiter directly at Careers@Hyland.com.

Welcome to #HylandLife

Since 1991, it has been Hyland’s mission to help our employees, customers and partners exceed their potential with our industry-leading content services platform. Our employees exude a contagious energy and are passionate about what they do – whether it’s helping customers succeed, raising up their fellow Hylanders, or engaging in the communities where they live and work.

The #HylandLife hashtag encompasses our employee-centric culture. Our employees live our culture day in and day out by bringing their best self to work. Hyland supports them to do just that through career development resources, wellbeing programs and innovation practices. We thrive on diverse viewpoints and new ideas and believe that a positive, inclusive workplace is imperative to sustainable success.

As we’ve grown to a company of nearly 4,000 strong, we have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our communities. We strongly support employee initiatives and align our giving campaigns and programs to organizations that are important to them.

We are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. description:
The Cloud Operations team at Poshmark fill the mission-critical role of ensuring that our complex, large-scale systems are healthy, monitored, automated, and designed to scale. You'll use your interest in site operations/DevOps and your experience writing code to work closely with our development teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues.

What You'll Do:
Over 10 weeks the Intern will work on a challenging project designed to blend Automation and Operational work. The projects can involve developing automation scripts, plugins and apps to monitor the availability and security of our large scale system as well as assist with application deployments, testing and building new automation systems. You will be assigned a mentor and peer-level buddy to help you throughout your internship to make sure you have an incredible Internship experience.

Experience relevant to Poshmark:
Pursuing a CS degree (or related field)
Strong knowledge of Python/Perl/Ruby/JavaScript scripting languages.
Familiarity with working in Linux/Unix environments
Exposure to GIT/SVN
Ability and passion to learn, research, test new technologies
Clear written and verbal communication skills
A curious nature with a desire to tackle and solve complex problems
Non-academic coding experience (i.e. hack-a-thons, code challenges, personal projects, GitHub, Open Source, volunteer coding experience, conference participation, Grace Hopper, etc.)

Things that catch our eye:
Exposure to HTTP protocol, SSL, and REST API's.
Familiarity with any Cloud solutions (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience with: Tomcat, Redis, MongoDB, ElasticSearch.

Why Poshmark?

Poshmark is a leading social commerce platform for the next generation of retailers and shoppers. Through technology, our mission is to build the world's most connected shopping experience, while empowering people to build thriving retail businesses. Since launching in 2011, Poshmark has become a vibrant social shopping community with five million Seller Stylists helping 40 million users discover items they love from over 75 million listings. The company is backed by the world's leading investment firms including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit www.poshmark.com, or find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and YouTube.

About us

At Poshmark, we're constantly challenging the status quo and are looking for innovative and passionate people to help shape the future of Poshmark. We're disrupting the industry by combining social connections with e-commerce through data-driven solutions and the latest technology to optimize our platform. We're nothing without our amazing team who deliver an unparalleled social shopping experience to the millions of people we connect each day.

We built Poshmark around four core values: 1) focus on people to create empowered communities that drive success; 2) together we grow to support each other to strive for our dreams; 3) lead with love to foster genuine connections built upon a foundation of respect; and 4) embrace your weirdness to accept and empower one another on their own unique journey. We're invested in our team and community, working together to build an entirely new way to shop. That way, when we win, we all win together. Come help us build the most connected shopping experience ever.

Here's what we'll set you up with:
A team that is invested in your career growth and training
Competitive pay, based on experience
Work alongside world-class talent
Personal style encouraged (or not, whatever you're in to)

Poshmark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description:
GNSS Software Engineer Intern

Summer 2021 internship applications are open September 2020. Samsung Semiconductor summer internships start in May/June 2021.

Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development. You’ll work with the teams that create new computing system architectures needed to support emerging machine learning applications, internet of things (IoT) and edge computing that benefit millions of users. This program will give you the opportunity work on complex solutions to that address some of the world’s most complex technological challenges.

OVERVIEW

Based in San Jose, California, Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. (SSI) is a multi-billion dollar subsidiary of Samsung Electronics, Ltd. and a world leader in Memory, System LSI and LCD technologies. We provide the widest range of memory, logic, storage devices, LED components and LCD/OLED panels to enhance the user experience in home entertainment, mobile devices, lighting and computing. SSI has advanced R&D labs focused on product design and research in memory, displays, logic, image sensors, and mobile technologies.

Samsung’s Cedar Rapid’s Location Group was established to develop market-leading location technology for mobile applications. We have a team of about 80 people in the US driving our technology forward for future generation products. Our main activities include architecture definition, silicon design, software development, and platform integration. The Location Group is now part of Samsung’s Application Processor and Modem Group. We work closely together to develop highly integrated products, and to find opportunities to optimize our products for market success. The group is looking for a GNSS Software Engineer.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Participate in the review of GNSS location software changes for performance enhancements
Enhance, maintain and support GNSS location software code base
Expand and maintain GNSS location software testing and analysis framework.
Maximize automation of test results analysis and evaluation
Analyze field test data and do root cause analysis of field issues
Classify issues reported by customers by mapping them to appropriate technical issues

REQUIRED SKILLS

Pursuing a MS/PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering or related field
Proficient C and Python programming skills
Familiarity with GNSS
Experience with MATLAB
Familiarity with Groovy, Gerritt, Git, Jira
Demonstrated ability to work as a team player as part of a local and globally distributed team
A self-motivated engineer with good task execution skills to deliver high quality output in timely manner
Solid communication and document skills
Strong mathematical and analytical abilities

***********************************************************************************************************************

Samsung Semiconductor Inc. (SSI), an equal opportunity employer, is a world leader in Memory, System LSI, and LCD technologies. Headquartered in San Jose, California, SSI is a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.- the second largest semiconductor manufacturer in the world and the industry's volume and technology leader in DRAM, NAND Flash, SSDs, mobile DRAM and graphics memory. It is one of the largest providers of system logic, imaging and LED lighting solutions, as well as providing advanced process design and manufacturing for fabless companies. Samsung Semiconductor, Inc. also has a research and innovation center with numerous labs providing product design and research in: logic, memory, image sensors, displays and mobile technologies. In addition, the company supports Samsung Display Company, the largest producer of LCD and OLED displays.

***********************************************************************************************************************

A day in the life Samsung Video: http://bit.ly/1saHOGu

Click here to visit our Samsung Semiconductor Intern Career Page

description:
Job Summary :
TDIndustries has exciting Internship opportunities available for students interested in partnering with an innovative and growing organization. The selected candidate will team with an Project Manager, this position implements and commissions Building Automation control systems equipment that has been newly installed.

Company Overview:
Established in 1946, TDIndustries has developed into one of America's premier Mechanical Construction and Facility Services companies serving clients through the full life-cycle of a facility, to include engineering, construction, operations and maintenance. For 70 years, our employee-owned company has provided innovative services that optimize the performance of world-class mechanical and electrical systems that serve healthcare facilities, hotels, schools, sports arenas, mission critical facilities and industrial complexes and other essential institutions.

Our employees, whom we call “Partners” are the heart of our success and what sets us apart from our competitors. FORTUNE Magazine recognized TDIndustries as one of the "100 Best Places to Work", "Top 50 Training Organizations" and "Top 30 Companies to Retire From" due to our solid commitment to the personal and professional development of each employee.

Essential Duties:
Participates in the installation, startup and commissioning of Building Automation systems projects.
Troubleshoots and resolves routine inconsistencies in the functions or sequence of operations; resolves basic issues. Participates in the set up and configuration of PC workstations, user interfaces; data servers, IP Networking devices, routers, switches, mass storage devices and hubs. Confirms proper network performance.
Provides support for the scheduling of trade contractors to coordinate installation and startup services as needed; participates in the coordination of network drops, IP addresses and monitoring tools with customer's IT Department personnel; works with equipment vendors to coordinate communication protocols, encryption, and database requirements for integration to their systems.
Works with building owners and managers to demonstrate system operation and verify consistency; participates in final inspection and testing; assures customer acceptance; trains customers on system operations. Completes and submits routine written reports; provides system documentation to engineering for as-built drawings.

Minimum Requirements:
Current Junior or Senior majoring in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering Technology, or
Architectural Engineering
3.0 GPA or higher
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
Experience with PowerPoint, Word, and Excel preferred

description:
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

The Primary Role of this position is:
Working with a mentor, develop test programs for debugging, characterizing and production testing next-generation AMD processors. Work on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) platforms and System Level Test (SLT) platforms. Debug test infrastructure issues including test hardware, test software, and product-specific IP. Develop software tools and scripts that support Test process.

Support overall compatibility, compliance, and test coverage of processors from product definition through product qualification and into high volume production by developing product specific test hardware, software and diagnostics. The test platforms and test infrastructure use various coding and scripting languages like Java, C++, C, Python, PERL, and Ruby to manipulate the device under test to ensure proper device functionality.

Potential roles of a Product Development Co-op include:
Develops and implements test programs/software to test and analyze AMD products.
Develops test requirements and specifications.
Develops software tools and scripts that support test process, program debug/audit, test time analysis etc.
Performs logic and circuit design verification via software and hardware.
Works with product engineering, characterization and platform debug teams to define and debug existing and new products.
Debugs test infrastructure issues in hardware, software, device, or manufacturing flow domains.
Support product improvement activities including driving cost reduction and yield improvement initiatives and resolving quality issues.
Works on related projects and/or assignments as needed.

Qualifications:
Years of experience and education: Candidates will be enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering.

Required Skills:
Experience with C++ or other high level software programming languages (Java, C, C#)
Courses in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Digital Logic, Circuit Theory
Familiar with Linux or Unix Operating Systems
Familiar with Microsoft standard apps (i.e. Office), Microsoft Windows Operating Systems

Preferred Skills:
Scripting language experience with Perl, Ruby, shell script, or similar
Experience in the XP, AGILE, Scrum, and/or Kanban programming paradigms.

Experience with revision control (SVN,CVS,RCS or similar) on a large software project

Job Function: Student/ Intern/ Temp

We are a fast-growth startup targeting the reseller space. We make it easy for resellers to sell, manage, and optimize their income by enabling them to sell on multiple platforms at once. We are looking for a senior engineer (who will be the first engineer and part of the founding team) to help build out our product. You will need to think creatively and manage your own work process. position: WEST - San Jose - Risk Consulting Intern - Summer 2021
qualifications:
Time management

Microsoft Excel

Microsoft Office
